content.rendered:
What is an Aircraft Mechanic?

Aircraft Mechanics (AMTs) are responsible for repairs, running diagnostics and checking up on all sorts of aircrafts. Some of their responsibilities include routine maintenance and problem diagnosing.

Where does an Aircraft Mechanic work?

  • Airline companies
  • Government
  • Private airline companies

How much do Aircraft Mechanics make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for an Aircraft Mechanics is $53,490.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Aircraft Mechanics?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing Aircraft Mechanic jobs.

  • Aerospace engineering majors
  • Aviation management majors
  • General engineering majors

Explore Aircraft Mechanic job opportunities on Handshake.

Aircraft Mechanic skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Aircraft Mechanics succeed in their work:

  • Attention to detail
  • Knowledge of makes and models of aircrafts
  • Strong communication skills

What are some common questions about Aircraft Mechanics?

Q: How long is Aircraft Mechanic school?

A: About 18 months.
